comments.html: Junos used to spawn a dedicated thread only if the precision-timers knob (sub-15ms hold time) was applied, now I think it is baked in by default. Design sanity is good but I think it's still a trivial job to choke keepalives..on any vendor platform not properly protected. If there occurs a mega-failure someday it will probably be related to this. Even the processes meant to protect systems (policers) can also smother it.
comments.name: Jeff Behrns
